answers.answer: Hi,Are there other signs o rsymptoms present? Do you have a personal history of diabetes?  There are many factors that may be the cause of your condition. In particular, MRSA, or methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus, is a bacterium that can cause serious infections. It is resistant to numerous antibiotics including methicillin and penicillin.Most MRSA infections are skin infections that produce the following signs and symptoms: cellulitis, boils, abscesses, carbuncles or  impetigo. It is important that this condition is ruled out from the differentials. It is best that you have this evaluated by your doctor to rule out bacterial infection.Take care and keep us posted.
i was tasted for msra and alltest came back negivie for any infectionsno history of  diabetes am very healthy  not over wieght  dont drink dont smoke live well

question: last oct i had a spot on my leg open up my dr could only control it withfluocinonide ointment three months later she discovered i had clear cell skin leshion so i had it surgikly removed it stil did not heal for 3 or 4 months. It was fine all summer and till this weekend. Now it is opening back up again. I am wondering if it is weather or temp related or if you have any ideas.
title: open sore on leg
